intro: Rollinia laurifolia f. longipes, commonly known as the long-peduncled laurelberry, is a unique variant of the species Rollinia laurifolia. It is characterized by its elongated peduncles, which are the stalks supporting the fruiting structures. The plant belongs to the family Caricaceae and is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are thick, glossy, and leathery, with a dark green color, while the fruits are small, round, and yellow when mature.
